parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A long flowing outer garment, tunic. Neuter of a presumed derivative of ennumi; a dress.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Very; very much, exceedingly, greatly. Of uncertain affinity; much.
White, bright, brilliant. From luke; white.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Plural
str2: Probably akin to ho, hos, and hosos; such or what sort of; especially the neuter with negative, not so.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A fuller, cloth-dresser. By variation for a derivative from knapto; a cloth-dresser.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
To whiten, make white. From leukos; to whiten.
